channel.title: 2d java?
channel.description:
i wana get a boost in my java knowledge but my main goal is to learn how to do java 2d ever since i was little ive always wanted to make my own game but i have no clue where to start
i want to start out with small things and learn some new things i just know very basic things from private servers and some other things from the math application i made a few months ago
itd be nice if you guys could hook me up with some tutorials im going to be googling this to and look back in on the topic

They don’t try to correct you because you don’t deserve to be corrected. When someone does try and correct you, you make up some stupid retort, e.g “I put it like that because it looks cool”, or “Yes but making UI programs is so much better because it’s easier”. If I was to reiterate on your incompetent replies I would be here for a life time, and quite frankly I don’t think I have the patience to.
[/quote]
Don’t forget “It’s fkn pimp”[/quote]
Oh, that’s very popular too.

item.title: 2d java?
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

the main(String[]) method is the entry-point for the JVM. It needs to be there (atleast somewhere), so the JVM can start the application.

Why it is static?
Well, this is mainly because you havn’t created an instance yet, and therefore it has to be static. Instance-members (variables, methods etc) can only be used if you already created an instance, and call on them through this instance. All instance-members are not related to any other instance-member of the same type in any other instances of the same class (if that made any sense?).

Static, however, normally means the member will change to the latest changed member (if applicable). If you call on a static-member, there are only one ‘instance’ of that member. If you modify a static-member from one class in another class, and call on it in yet another class, this static-member will be what you changed it to in the other class. It seems complicated how I write it, but I don’t know how else to write it.

I hope you understand, though.

Read full topic

item.title: 2d java?
item.dc:creator: @openice123 openice123
item.description:
@openice123 wrote:

kk thanks i need to learn key events but i started working on trying to load images cus that was my first guess

[code]import java.awt.;
import java.lang.;
import java.io.*;

import java.awt.image.BufferedImage;
import javax.imageio.ImageIO;

public class Main {

public void main(String args[]) {
	loadImage("test.png");
}

public void run() {

}

public Main() {
}

public void loadImage(String file) {
	BufferedImage img = null;
	try {
		img = ImageIO.read(new File(file));
	} catch (IOException e) {
		System.out.println("exception - Method: loadIamge Class: Main");
	}
}

}[/code]

Read full topic
